review_title: Low Stress and Friendly Work Environment
pros: A great positive experiences for employment. There is an open door policy between staff and management within my department. There is culture of respect and inclusion campus wide. This is an amazing place to work, especially with quickly earned sick and vacation time. Holiday and winter breaks paid immediately is a perk for sure.
cons: Lower pay comparatively to similar positions, but time perks (including encouraged "wellness time" during week) and health benefits make up the difference

pros: This is a terrible terrible place to work. Look at the number of assistant professors who have left this place voluntarily, it isn’t because tenure is difficult to get, it is because having tenure at a terrible job is not a good thing.
cons: Forced faculty into 12 month contracts during the pandemic for no reason except spite.

pros: Most of the faculty are supportive and wonderful to work with. By and large, they are dedicated and committed.
cons: If you are seeking management that is competent, that values its faculty, and that is supportive, this is not the place for you. The faculty are working in an extraordinarily stressful environment due to upper management incompetence. Faculty compensation is at least 20% below the national average for similar institutions.
